citypop shrine

citypop!!! a vaguely-defined music genre(?) from 70’s/80’s japan, it’s really more about the vibes i think

here are some of my favorite picks!

(bonus: “citypop” art)

windy summer

when someone asks what citypop’s all about, windy summer by anri is my go-to example!

it’s bright and upbeat, with a boppin’ horn section and slappin’ bass, some 80’s synths/keyboards(?), and the beloved sax solo – all ingredients for that quintessential citypop flavor! bonus points for the summer mood and “adjective noun” naming convention

(also, for any cat’s eye fans, anri did the original 1983 anime opening as well as the lupin iii vs. cat’s eye 2023 version!!)

summer blue

there are a lot of energetic songs on this list, so here’s summer blue by bread and butter with a warm, laid-back feeling i love!

watashitachi o shinjite ite

watashitachi o shinjite ite by cindy has no business being such a bop and a groove… a boove if you will…

heart de furimuite

sorry for the unofficial vids LOL, but heart de furimuite by kanako wada was on my brain radio list as 1 of 2 songs that start immediately great retro(?) flavor!

welcome to: the tatsuro yamashita zone!

sparkle

tatsuro yamashita is one of my favorite artists of all time!! the “king of citypop” has too many hits to list here (and he’s still making music!) so here’s a classic – sparkle by tatsuro yamashita, as featured in that giant isopod tumblr post LMAOOO

paper doll (live)

since all his songs are getting nuked off youtube1 here’s a personal upload, my favorite version of paper doll by tatsuro yamashita! a 13-minute LIVE recording packed with awesome keyboard and electric guitar solos!!

in the studio version he sings way softer, almost like he’s whispering, which isn’t bad – but i love how he sings fully here, filling the venue!

itsuka hareta hini

another upload, itsuka hareta hini by tatsuro yamashita! a soft bop with a nice melody…

bomber

for a funkier pick, here’s bomber by tatsuro yamashita! love how the best vid is a rhythm game beatmap 😭 thank you gamers!! also, there’s another version that starts with 15 seconds of jackhammer noises for some reason LOL

misty mauve

misty mauve by tatsuro yamashita was my favorite tatsuro song for a long while, perhaps because it feels a bit different from his usual! a couple trivias:

1) this was originally written for masayuki suzuki, with yamashita composing and mariya takeuchi on lyrics! you might recognize masayuki suzuki from the openings of kaguya-sama: love is war, including the super catchy daddy! daddy! do!

2) one of my jojo stands was named misty mauve! to avoid copyright it would be localized as purple haze… which would of course get struck a second time LOL

morning glory

a citypop legend covering her husband tatsuro yamashita’s song – morning glory by mariya takeuchi! i prefer her version LOL, she has a really smooth voice and effortlessly glides through lower(?) ranges like these!

you’ve probably heard her ultra popular plastic love, a “staple” of the late 2010’s citypop renaissance! and for a more dramatic(?) pick showcasing her vocal quality, check out eki by mariya takeuchi!

melody for you

like windy summer, melody for you by toshiki kadomatsu flaunts all the appeals of citypop, just slower and smoother! the sax solos are FLAWLESS

take you to the sky high by toshiki kadomatsu comes in extremely close second place, it’s so hype LMAO! i’m also a fan of his instrumental album legacy of you, so here’s twilight river by toshiki kadomatsu!

fun fact: kadomatsu also worked on the anri album at the top of this page, “timely!!”

international tunes

some non-japanese songs i’d consider citypop, or at least adjacent

visa pour aimer by plaisir

it must be magic by teena marie

bonus: “citypop” art

some artists i love who are associated with the citypop “aesthetic”!

open in new tab for high res!!

hiroshi nagai

eizin suzuki

the middle pic is indeed tatsuro yamashita’s album, “for you”! :^)

  • 1 yamashita doesn’t put his music on american(?) music streaming services, so they’re all unofficial uploads…
